reference.title: Making tables accessible
reference.shortdesc: The complex nature of table rendering requires authors and processors to be aware of several DITA elements and attributes. This topic describes many common accessibility guidelines related to tables, along with the DITA markup designed to support them.

section.p: DITA provides two table models, a more complex one using the table element and the other using simpletable. The table is based on the OASIS Exchange Table Model, while the second is a simpler model that is closer to an HTML table. Each table model is addressed here. For some cases, such as a table with two header rows or two header columns, the more complex table element needs to be used.

dlentry.dd: Both table models allow for a caption using the title element.

While the summary attribute on tables is deprecated in HTML5, the desc element within a table can be used to store a summary. The description also is often used for rendered content about the table, so processors might need to be configured to support this use.

When using a table element, one or more header rows can be specified in the thead element.
When using a simpletable element, the header row can be placed in a sthead element.

When using a table element, set the rowheader attribute to firstcol on the table element to indicate that the first column is a header. Alternatively, set the scope attribute in the first entry in the first row to col, indicating that it is a header for the entire column.
When using a simpletable element, set the keycol attribute to 1.

When using a table element, use the column specifications (colspec) to define which columns function as headers. For that case, set the attribute rowheader to headers on the column or columns that function as headers. Alternatively, set the scope attribute on each relevent entry in the first row to col, indicating that the entry is a header for the entire column.
When using a simpletable element, set the keycol attribute to the number of the column that functions as a header.

dlentry.dt: Irregular header cells within a table
dlentry.dd: When entries within a table funtion as headers, but do not fall into the row or column descriptions above, the id and headers attributes on table entries can be used to relate any entry to the header. Set the id attribute on the cell that functions as a header, and set the headers attribute to that ID value on any entry for which it acts as a header.
